qas.question: With whom did the Dutch Republic align?

answers.text: The Dutch Republic, long-time British ally, kept its neutrality intact

qas.question: Which side of the coalitions did Naples, Sicily and Savoy join?

answers.text: Naples, Sicily, and Savoy, although sided with Franco-Spanish party, declined to join the coalition under the fear of British power

qas.question: How did the war impact the Russian population?

answers.text: The taxation needed for war caused the Russian people considerable hardship

qas.question: What items had already been taxed by Russian Empress Elizabeth?

answers.text: being added to the taxation of salt and alcohol begun by Empress Elizabeth in 1759

qas.question: What two countries concluded a separate peace with Prussia?

answers.text: Like Sweden, Russia concluded a separate peace with Prussia.

context: Many middle and small powers in Europe, unlike in the previous wars, tried to steer clear away from the escalating conflict, even though they had interests in the conflict or with the belligerents, like Denmark-Norway. <a0_0>The Dutch Republic, long-time British ally, kept its neutrality intact<a0_0/>, fearing the odds against Britain and Prussia fighting the great powers of Europe, even tried to prevent Britain's domination in India. <a1_0>Naples, Sicily, and Savoy, although sided with Franco-Spanish party, declined to join the coalition under the fear of British power<a1_0/>. <a2_0>The taxation needed for war caused the Russian people considerable hardship<a2_0/>, <a3_0>being added to the taxation of salt and alcohol begun by Empress Elizabeth in 1759<a3_0/> to complete her addition to the Winter Palace. <a4_0>Like Sweden, Russia concluded a separate peace with Prussia.
